item.ceramics.unfired.barrel.name: Unfired Clay Barrel
ceramics.jei.bucket: Clay buckets are an early game alternative to the standard iron bucket. Like their iron counterparts, they can be used to transport liquids, but will break after pouring out a hot liquid.
ceramics.jei.barrel.base: Barrels are a simple fluid storage block, storing up to %s buckets. If broken, the barrel will lose its fluid.
ceramics.jei.barrel.extension: Barrel extensions can be placed above barrels to extend the capacity. An extension adds %s buckets to the capacity, and can be additionally placed on an extension for nearly unlimited height.
ceramics.jei.barrel.porcelain.base: Porcelain barrels are an upgraded version of the clay barrel with a capacity of %s buckets. Like its clay counterpart, it will lose its fluid when broken.
ceramics.jei.barrel.porcelain.extension: Porcelain barrel extensions can be used to extend a porcelain barrel's capacity. The function the same as the clay extensions except they add %s to the capacity, though clay and porcelain extension and barrels can not be mixed.
ceramics.jei.faucet: Faucets can be used to extract fluids from a tank into the one below. They can be placed on the sides or bottom of a block, and can be activated either by right click or redstone. The faucet will pour until it runs out of fluid or until the tank below is full.
ceramics.jei.channel: Channels can be used to transport fluids. They must be filled using a faucet, but will output to surrounding tanks and channels automatically. The connections of a channel on the sides and bottom can be configured after placing between in, out, and disabled by right clicking the channel.
